etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin, literally ‘appearance, form, beauty’, from specere ‘to look’

definitions: a group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding. The species is the principal natural taxonomic unit, ranking below a genus and denoted by a Latin binomial, e.g. Homo sapiens.
shortDefinitions: group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes or interbreeding

definitions: a group subordinate to a genus and containing individuals agreeing in some common attributes and called by a common name.
shortDefinitions: group subordinate to genus and containing individuals agreeing in some common attributes

examples.text: a species of invective at once tough and suave

definitions: used humorously to refer to people who share a characteristic or occupation

examples.text: a political species that is becoming more common, the environmental statesman

shortDefinitions: used humorously to refer to people who share characteristic or occupation

definitions: a particular kind of atom, molecule, ion, or particle
shortDefinitions: particular kind of atom, molecule or particle

definitions: the visible form of each of the elements of consecrated bread and wine in the Eucharist.
shortDefinitions: visible form of each of elements of consecrated bread and wine in Eucharist
